props.synopsis: Labor's Senate leader Penny Wong moved the motion, saying Senator Thorpe's actions had compromised workplace safety in the Senate.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe suspended from Senate for rest of the week after she ripped up Pauline Hanson's motion

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A NSW Supreme Court jury has returned its verdict over the death of a great-grandmother who had a fatal confrontation with police in an aged care home.

title.children: Jury finds police officer who tasered 95yo woman guilty of manslaughter

image.altText: Qantas takes delivery of A380 Airbus

props.synopsis: The safety regulator has lashed national carrier Qantas over a "cascade of errors" that saw a 1.25-metre tool left in an engine for 300 hours of flying time.

title.children: Qantas called out for process failures and 'cascade of errors' over 1.25m tool left in A380 engine

image.altText: An aerial view of a retirement village surrounded by a body of water. The buildings have matching grey rooves.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will become the first state to force retirement village operators to sign up to a mandatory code of conduct as part of a crackdown on the sector that also includes more transparency on how fees are calculated.

title.children: Victoria cracks down on retirement village operators after ABC investigation

image.altText: Flames and smoke rise from a cluster of high-rise buildings hit by airstrikes at night.

props.synopsis: The ceasefire is an obvious relief to many and reveals three major achievements from Israel's devastating response to Hezbollah, but it could also signal the start of a more intense conflict with Iran.

title.children: A ceasefire in Lebanon is a relief to many — until Netanyahu teases his next big plan

image.altText: Women welcome people returning to Tyre with smiles on their face

props.synopsis: So far, there has been no signs of violations from Israel and Hezbollah after a ceasefire began at 4am local time in southern Lebanon.

title.children: Displaced people welcomed home across southern Lebanon after ceasefire holds in early stages

image.altText: A woman in a blue police shirt stares ahead

props.synopsis: Karen Webb has faced criticism for her handling of the case of Clare Nowland. Less than four hours after senior constable Kristian White was convicted of manslaughter, the NSW Police commissioner admitted she was "always learning".

title.children: Quick response to manslaughter verdict shows commissioner has learned some lessons

image.altText: Wedge Fire, WA

props.synopsis: A firefighter is in hospital after being burned while battling a blaze near Wedge Island, with another man treated for minor injuries.

title.children: Two firefighters injured while battling out-of-control blaze in WA's Midwest

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek holds a python at Parliament House

props.synopsis: After an intense day on Tuesday of last-minute negotiations and lobbying by environmental and mining groups in which a deal was said to have "come close", the government has now shelved the talks.

title.children: WA premier lobbied Albanese to kill Greens deal on environmental reform in eleventh hour intervention

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and tie looks seriously off the camera.

props.synopsis: Counsel assisting the coroner has made final submissions with scathing accusations of former NT police constable Zachary Rolfe, in the inquest into the shooting death of Aboriginal man Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: Zachary Rolfe allegedly held 'overtly racist attitudes' and 'lied' in court, coroner told

image.altText: A young boy playing cricket.

props.synopsis: Australian cricket is booming at junior levels but as the sport attracts a more diverse and higher player base, the pressure on some of these kids is becoming too much and burnout looms.

title.children: 'Sixty overs in a weekend': The parent trap causing burnout in cricket's generation next

image.altText: A man stands at a lectern.

props.synopsis: The ABC's chair Kim Williams calls for more investment in the public broadcaster as a counter to the "flood" of online misinformation and disinformation, days after the federal government's decision to abandon legislation that would have forced social media giants to tackle harmful content on their platforms.

title.children: ABC chair warns Australia 'flooded' with misinformation days after government abandons bill to tackle social media content

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane on October 31, 2018.

props.synopsis: Some first home buyers could find their way into the market sooner under a new federal government scheme. Here's what to know.

title.children: The federal government's Help to Buy scheme is coming and this is how you can take part

image.altText: Workers in a broccoli field, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Temporary migrant workers in Australia are facing "disturbing" patterns of exploitation from some employers, the United Nations Special Rapporteur on contemporary forms of slavery, has warned after touring Australia.

title.children: Temporary migrant workers in Australia facing 'disturbing' patterns of exploitation from employers, UN official says

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: A Virgin flight was forced to make an abrupt U-turn over Bass Strait less than half an hour from its destination after missing a runway curfew due to planned upgrade works.

title.children: Virgin flight does U-turn over Bass Strait after missing Hobart airport curfew

image.altText: A hand holding a $10 and $20 note of cash.

props.synopsis: The federal government announced a plan to change the way student debts were indexed months ago. Now the legislation will finally start saving students money.

title.children: HECS changes are finally law. It could mean student debt credits for some — and refunds for others

image.altText: An extreme close up of Angela Merkel with half of her face bathed in sunlight, with the other in darkness

props.synopsis: During her 16 years in office, former German chancellor Angela Merkel served alongside countless world leaders. In her new memoir, she takes aim at Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump.

title.children: Merkel's new memoir details Putin's power games and Trump's antics

image.altText: Tony Burke speaks at a press conference at Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The government proposal is expected to pass through parliament this week with the support of the Coalition.

title.children: 'A dark day in our history': Refugee advocates warn Labor laws put thousands at risk

image.altText: Household money pic

props.synopsis: Australia's inflation rate remained steady in October, with rising prices for food, alcohol, cigarettes and recreational activities keeping it at 2.1 per cent annually.

title.children: RBA still unlikely to lower interest rates in 2024 despite inflation at its lowest level in more than three years

image.altText: A picture of a pill

props.synopsis: A synthetic opioid linked to overdose deaths has been detected in a suspected counterfeit oxycontin tablet at a Brisbane pill testing site, triggering an urgent alert.

title.children: '1,000 times more potent than morphine': Synthetic opioid linked to overdose deaths detected at Brisbane pill testing site

image.altText: A blue sign reading "International Criminal Court" in front of a building

props.synopsis: Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, who took power from elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi in a coup in 2021, is accused of crimes against humanity for the deportation and persecution of the Rohingya.

title.children: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrant for Myanmar military ruler Min Aung Hlaing over alleged crimes against humanity

image.altText: A truck stuck under a rail bridge.

props.synopsis: A joint taskforce aims to combat a rising number of crashes into low clearance rail bridges across south-east Queensland.

title.children: 'Red-faced, wedged under a bridge': Police crackdown after Queensland rail bridges struck almost 400 times in a year

image.altText: A close up photo of Ratu Meli Bainimarama arriving at court

props.synopsis: Ratu Meli Bainimarama was sentenced after attacking an ex-girlfriend in Sydney, leaving her with a ruptured ear drum.

title.children: Son of Fiji's former PM sentenced to 28 months in jail over violent attack on ex-girlfriend in Sydney

image.altText: A poster shows mens faces that are on the FBI most wanted list

props.synopsis: Daniel Andreas San Diego is wanted in the US for bombings in the San Francisco area was arrested and now faces extradition to the America, officials said.

title.children: One of FBI's most wanted fugitives arrested in UK after 20 years on the run

image.altText: Two men talking to media.

props.synopsis: The bodies of two Melbourne teenagers who died after suspected methanol poisoning in Laos return home, as Laos police investigating their deaths detain eight men.

title.children: 'We miss our daughters desperately': Families of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles welcome Laos arrests

image.altText: Sun shines against power pole in NSW.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns had asked businesses and homes to reduce energy use between 3pm and 8pm this evening as large-scale power shortages were expected across the state.

title.children: Risk of power supply shortage in NSW 'considerably reduced' as warning downgraded

image.altText: A composite image of a bright red and white sign that says 'coles' and a white sign that says 'woolworths' with a green icon.

props.synopsis: In their final sitting week, Australian Labor has introduced the new grocery code of conduct for supermarkets and their suppliers.

title.children: Supermarkets could face fines up to $10 million under new grocery code  introduced to parliament

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars of Australian $50 notes showing Edith Cowan

props.synopsis: Tasmanian politicians could be required to disclose any donation that exceeds $1,000 after opposition parties banded together to force a Greens bill through the lower house.

title.children: Tasmanian donation disclosure limits could drop to $1,000 after bill passes lower house

image.altText: A woman rests her head on another woman's shoulder.

props.synopsis: It was two days before Christmas when Mary Malbiynga's little sister was killed by her partner at Darwin's famous Mindil Beach.

title.children: Screams for 20 minutes and no help. Inside the NT's domestic violence tragedy

image.altText: A man in cuffs between two police officers.

props.synopsis: Police are working to find 27-year-old woman Dahkota Harris who detectives allege was among three people that kidnapped and shot a man in a forest on the NSW Mid North Coast 10 days ago.

title.children: Police seek third suspect after man left 'naked and bleeding' in alleged Port Macquarie kidnapping

image.altText: Tyler smiles while holding up a large nugget of gold.

props.synopsis: Tyler Mahoney likes to call herself a "professional gold digger" — but that doesn't mean what you think it means.

title.children: In a world where card payments rule, this 'gold digger' says cash is still king in the outback

props.synopsis: The Chinese national, in Australia illegally, has been sentenced in a Queensland court for using a SIM box to send out millions of fake texts purporting to be from agencies including Centrelink and Australia Post, but claims he was unaware they were part of a phishing scam.

title.children: Scammer who sent five million rogue texts claims he thought he was working in advertising

image.altText: A brown snake is in a white bag, in its mouth is the tail of another snake.

props.synopsis: A snake catcher was "very excited" to see the uncommon sight of an eastern brown snake eating a fellow brown snake during a routine removal from a property in Wingfield, north-west of Adelaide.

title.children: 'It's not very often that you see cannibalism in brown snakes': Snake catcher finds eastern brown feasting on fellow serpent

image.altText: A close up of a woman in reflective sunglasses and rugged up in a sleeping bag, appears emotional, with clouds behind and below.

props.synopsis: Chris Kerr faced more challenges than most to get to the top of Africa's tallest peak, but she was adamant being a wheelchair user would not stop her.

title.children: Woman celebrates life-changing journey to summit of Mount Kilimanjaro in all-terrain wheelchair
